intro: Asplundianthus trachyphyllus, commonly known as the rough-leaved asplundianthus, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions in Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and small, clustered flowers. The leaves are typically rough or hairy, giving the plant its common name, and they are often arranged oppositely along the stems. This plant thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in dry or semi-arid environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in ecological and horticultural contexts.
